description: Trading analysis dashboard for Old School RuneScape's Grand Exchange that fetches price data from OSRS Wiki API, identifies profitable flip opportunities, and helps users find the best trades based on their budget.

userStories.title: Items table migration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an items table to store basic item information.
acceptanceCriteria: Columns: id (integer, primary key - OSRS item ID), name (string), icon_filename (string nullable), buy_limit (integer nullable), members (boolean default false), high_alch (integer nullable), low_alch (integer nullable), created_at, updated_at
Migration runs successfully with `node ace migration:run`

userStories.title: Item prices table migration
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a prices table to store price snapshots.
acceptanceCriteria: Columns: id (auto increment), item_id (foreign key to items), high_price (integer nullable), low_price (integer nullable), high_time (datetime nullable), low_time (datetime nullable), synced_at (datetime)
Foreign key constraint on item_id with cascade delete

userStories.title: ItemPrice model
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an ItemPrice model to interact with the prices table.

userStories.title: OSRS Wiki API client
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a client to fetch data from the OSRS Wiki API.
acceptanceCriteria: Set User-Agent header: "osrs-ge-tracker - OSRS trading dashboard" (Wiki requires descriptive User-Agent)
Returns typed array: { id: number, name: string, examine: string, members: boolean, lowalch: number, highalch: number, limit: number, value: number, icon: string }[]
Returns typed object: { data: { [itemId: string]: { high: number, highTime: number, low: number, lowTime: number } } }
Throws Error with descriptive message on non-200 response

userStories.title: Items list endpoint - basic

acceptanceCriteria: Returns items joined with their latest price record (subquery for most recent synced_at per item)
Response shape: { data: [...items], meta: { total, page, limit, totalPages } }

userStories.title: Items list endpoint - calculated fields
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need profit calculations included in the items response.
acceptanceCriteria: Add calculated fields to items response: profit_margin (high_price - low_price), max_profit (profit_margin * buy_limit)
Default sort by max_profit descending (nulls last)

userStories.title: Items list endpoint - search
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need to search items by name.
acceptanceCriteria: Case-insensitive partial match on item name

userStories.title: Items list endpoint - filters
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need to filter items by price, margin, buy limit, and members status.
acceptanceCriteria: Add query params: `min_margin`, `max_margin` (filter on calculated profit_margin)
Add query param: `members` (boolean) - if true, only members items; if false, only F2P items; if omitted, all items
All filters combine with AND logic

userStories.title: Items list endpoint - sorting
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need to sort items by different criteria.
acceptanceCriteria: Add `sort` query param with options: profit, margin, price, name, buy_limit
Add `order` query param: asc, desc (default desc)
profit = max_profit, margin = profit_margin, price = low_price

userStories.title: Single item endpoint
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need to fetch detailed data for one item.
acceptanceCriteria: Returns item with latest price data
Includes all fields: name, icon_url, buy_limit, members, high_alch, low_alch
Includes price fields: high_price, low_price, high_time, low_time
Returns 404 with message if item not found

userStories.title: Suggestions endpoint
userStories.description: As a frontend, I need item recommendations based on a budget.
acceptanceCriteria: Required query param: `budget` (integer, GP amount). Returns 400 if missing or invalid.
Filter: only items where low_price <= budget AND low_price > 0 AND profit_margin > 0 AND buy_limit > 0
Returns top 6 items sorted by score descending
For each item, calculate: suggested_quantity = Math.min(Math.floor(budget / low_price), buy_limit), estimated_profit = suggested_quantity * profit_margin
Response includes all item fields plus suggested_quantity and estimated_profit
